intro: Amsinckia demissa, commonly known as the desert smokeplant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant has slender, hairy stems and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Amsinckia demissa is adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
